intro: Capraria biflora f. hirta, commonly known as the hairy capraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and stems. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
